content.description: Sit start with a right hand, sloping pocket and a left hand sidepull on the large hueco. From there, gain a left knee bar (rare for Unaweep!) in the hueco, bump the hand up to a sidepull, reach a bump with the right hand, bring the foot over the bulge onto the face, and finish up the remainder for an easy finish.
content.protection: A pad will work fine. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the center section of Rolling Stone's west face.

content.description: Sit start with your choice of edge. From there, climb straight up the generously featured face to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two will work well. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the south section of Rolling Stone's east face.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the thin arete. From there, climb the arete, commit to the bumps on the overhang, reach the nose, and finish up the remainder for an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is great though.
content.location: It climbs the southwest arete of Rolling Stone.

content.description: Sit start with your choice of edge at the boulder's northeast corner. From there, follow the rail up and left to its end to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is great, but the finish does climb over some rocky terrain.
content.location: It climbs the north section of Rolling Stone's east face.

content.description: Sit start with a low left hand edge and right hand sidepull on the large hueco. From there, pull up, slap the right hand up the hueco, reach a left hand crimp, commit the feet to the slab, and reach a left hand pinch and subsequent edges at the lip to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The immediate landing is great, but there are rocks directly behind the problem's fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the south portion of Rolling Stone's west face.

content.description: Sit start below the branch on edges. From there, traverse left to the prominent shelf (mind the dab potential here), reach the nose, and finish up on bumps for an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads will do. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Rolling Stone.
